intro: Glottiphyllum rubrostigma, commonly known as the red-stigma glottiphyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water, storing moisture in its thick leaves. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in the local ecosystem.
